channel.title: cheatsheet on Sparking Mind
channel.description: Recent content in cheatsheet on Sparking Mind

item.title: find cheatsheet
item.description: Frequently used option of Find TEST option description example -name find the file which name is filename find / -name “*.js” -group find the file belongs to group-name find / -group users -user find the file belongs to user-name find / -user root -maxdepth Descend at most levels to find find / -maxdepth 4 -empty find file is empty and is either a regular file or a directory find / -empty -path find file name matches shell pattern find / -path “/sr*sc” -perm find file’s permission bits are exactly mode find / -perm 0664 -perm - find all of the permission bits mode are set for the file find / -perm -644 -perm / find any of the permission bits mode are set for the file find / -perm /644 -regex find file name matches regular expression find / -regex “.

item.title: lvm thin pool cheatsheet
item.description: We use devicemapper as Docker storage driver, sometime any of the meta or data pool is full. We have to extend the pool Single step thin pool LV creation lvcreate --type thin-pool --poolmetadata <meta size> -L <pool size> <pool name> Manually manage free data space of thin pool LV lvextend -L <size> <pool name> Manually manage free metadata space of a thin pool LV lvs -oname,size,data_percent,metadata_percent # show the available metadat space in a thin pool LV lvextend --poolmetadatasize <size> <pool name> Metadata space exhaustion Metadata space exhaustion can lead to inconsistent thin pool metadata and inconsistent file systems, so the response requires offline checking and repair.

item.title: resize disk
item.description: Shrink a disk If the partition the file system is on is currently mounted, unmount it umount /dev/disk Run fsck on the umounted file system e2fsck -f /dev/disk Shrink the file system with the resize2fs /dev/fdisk size resize2fs /dev/disk size Use fdisk to modify the partition table information fdisk /dev/disk Mount the disk mount /dev/disk target

item.title: Shell Cheatsheet
item.description: Checking if string does or not contain other string Use ‘=’ or ‘!=’ if [[ ${testmystring} = *"c0"* ]];then # testmystring does contain c0 fi if [[ ${testmystring} != *"c0"* ]];then # testmystring does not contain c0 fi

item.title: mac cheatsheet
item.description: Reset Launchpad Layout in OS X El Capitan & Yosemite defaults write com.apple.dock ResetLaunchPad -bool true; killall Dock
